title: Sprinkles Cupcake Script
content:
Anybody care to take a stab at this? I’m looking for the font used for “Sprinkles” - I know it may be hand lettered, but it seems clean enough to be a font. I was handed this by a client who likes this, all I can see is “Giddyup”, but hey, it’s her money. Ed Script is a much better face IMHO, but I’d like to show her this as an option if it exists.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080404180315im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sprinkles_5941.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [sprinkles.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080404180315/http:/typophile.com/files/sprinkles_0.jpg) | 33.84 KB |

 [‹ I need this cool font please help!](http://web.archive.org/web/20080404180315/http:/typophile.com/node/43384 "Go to previous forum topic") [What is this? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080404180315/http:/typophile.com/node/43728 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Scott Leyes

comments.content:
I second your suspicion regarding hand-lettered – and it has been done by someone who has no idea of handwriting: how is this ‘k’ supposed to be written? An ‘h’ with an acute accent?  
 [Handsome](http://web.archive.org/web/20080404180315/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/shinntype/handsome_pro_thin_ot/?sample_text=Sprinkles&sample_size=60), among others, is much nicer.
Actually the oddity of the ’k’ makes it very nice. Some oddity is good. About “Handsome” it is great, but the bar is too high...

Actually, I shouldn’t have disparaged the font in my original post... there’s nothing “wrong” with it, it’s quite nice in a quirky kind of way, but it is COMPLETELY NOT appropriate for the product that it will be used to promote (either in a logo or packaging). Unfortunately, the client has a “thing” for the cupcakes, and this is their logo, so I am forced to offer this up as an option and try to talk her out of it.
